name: stdpc5
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1
body: |- wi(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))

stmt.origin: biimpi(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))
-| wb(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))
-| wb(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))
-| wnf(s0, w0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wi(w0, w1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)))
-| wnf(s0, w0)

comment: An axiom scheme of standard predicate calculus that emulates Axiom 5 of [Mendelson] p. 69. The hypothesis ` F/ x ph ` can be thought of as emulating " ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` ". With this definition, the meaning of "not free" is less restrictive than the usual textbook definition; for example ` x ` would not (for us) be free in ` x = x ` by ~ nfequid . This theorem scheme can be proved as a metatheorem of Mendelson's axiom system, even though it is slightly stronger than his Axiom 5. See ~ stdpc5v for a version requiring fewer axioms. (Contributed by NM, 22-Sep-1993.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Oct-2016.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 1-Jan-2018.) Remove dependency on ~ ax-10 . (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 4-Jul-2021.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 11-Oct-2021.)
